benchmark_details.name: ForgReason
benchmark_details.overview: ForgReason is a dataset dedicated to descriptions of forgery evidences in AI-generated images, curated through collaboration between an LLM-based agent and a team of human annotators to enhance model performance.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a refined dataset for training models to detect forgery in AI-generated images and to generate explanations that align with human reasoning.

data.source: Data is sourced from human annotations and LLM-generated captions for AI-generated images.
data.size: 2,215 images plus 5,000 real and 1,000 fake images
data.annotation: Annotations are provided by human annotators along with LLM-generated descriptions focusing on authenticity.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on detection accuracy and user evaluations of explanation quality.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better detection capability and more comprehensible explanations for users.
methodology.validation: Model validation is conducted using two major benchmarks and subjective evaluations.
